title: The one with all the submissions
body: First, if you haven't already noticed, there are two new phlogs waiting patiently in the sidebar. Go to them. GO! Trivia Slides I think it would be fun to pepper the pre-show ads with some Moxie flavored trivia slides. What do you think? Here's the kind of stuff I have in mind: Click to enlarge If you'd like to submit your ideas for Moxie slides, do so in the comments of this post. If it's good enough, and not overly offensive, it might just find it's way into the pre-show rotation. T-Shirts As I had mentioned in yesterday's post, it's high time for a Moxie T-Shirt. I'm thinking something along the lines of a small run, limited edition, only-for-blog-readers, totally awesome Moxie shirt! Logo on the front, blog address on the back... the trouble is, we need a catchy saying to accompany the logo. Nicole and I have argued back and forth over what the shirt should say, but we couldn't come to an agreement. She wants: Your mom goes to The Moxie. I want: I'll Moxie your butthole! Her slogan is an allusion to Napoleon Dynamite. Mine is just something I like to say. SO, what should the 1st run of Moxie shirts say? Drop your submission into the comments section - along with any Moxie slide ideas - and we'll record them all on a piece of paper and then accidentally lose it somewhere in the backyard. The winning slogan will receive a free Moxie T-Shirt and a printed picture of me packing the winning shirt into a box! Unfortunately, the person who submitted the slogan will receive nothing. Only the slogan is eligible to receive cool prizes. Perhaps you can talk the slogan into sharing the prizes with you... maybe. Maybe not. That's all. Start submitting... NOW!
author: Dan

comments.author: Justin
comments.body: HAH.  Till and Bed's Journey Bogus.

comments.author: Justin
comments.body: I also think you should pepper the pre-show with photos of people drinking and eating at the Cinebar, but make them overly cheesy.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: That's a good idea.

comments.author: Allison
comments.body:
Here are some off-the-cuff ideas:

Tshirt ideas:
-The Moxie: The New Black
-The Moxie, where the amps turn up to 11
-Everything's coming up Moxie!

Another fun theatre slide might be called Screen Shots where you ask how many cans of coke (or other object) the audience can find in some picture.  But then make the picture something totally obscure and without any hint of the object they're trying to find, like a random picture of a mountain lion or something.

comments.author: Jamie
comments.body: I don't have any super great ideas, but seeing as I just celebrated pi day yesterday, maybe the shirt could say something about pie, or cake.  We all love cake.  Fat kids like cake, we love the moxie!

comments.author: Ben D.
comments.body:
The Moxie: Like a fat kid on an M&M!
The Moxie: How much fried chicken can you eat?
The Moxie: You know how I roll.

comments.author: Ben D.
comments.body:
(This one's lame, but obvious.) "Show me The Moxie!"
"It took Moxie to get this shirt."
"I have more Moxie in my shirt than you have in your entire body."
"The Moxie gots mad skills."
"Fact: Chicks dig The Moxie."

comments.author: Ben D.
comments.body:
I'm just posting them as they come to me... Although most of these submissions are awful.

"There's no place like The Moxie."
"Do you know what they call a Quarter Pounder with Cheese at The Moxie? ... 
A Quarter Pounder with Cheese."

comments.author: justin
comments.body: For the shirt, you could use the example sentance listed in the dictionary for moxie. I kind of like it: “His prose has moxie, though it rushes and stumbles from a pent-up surge.”

comments.body: And yes, I spelled sentence wrong.

comments.body: And I f'd up my italic tags. FIX PLZ KTHX

comments.author: erin
comments.body:
i just thought i would say... drove by the moxie today. and saw the pretty red walls. looking very good. as good as something can look at 20/30 some odd mph.

i also thought i would say... my drawing teacher informed us that she might be showing some of her work there after you open... (duh. a not quite finished moxie might be a strange place for an exhibition.) and i think that is way neat. because jennifer is way neat. 

so. yay!
: )

comments.author: Monica and Friends
comments.body:
To keep with the idea of incorporating quotes from films into the slogan for the t-shirt, my friends and I thought of a few ideas:  
"Go back to MOXIE, bitch." (Donnie Darko)
"The first rule of MOXIE is: You do not talk about MOXIE." 
"You're not your f@!**ing MOXIE"
"Jokers to the left of me, clowns to the right, here I am stuck in the MOXIE with you." (from Reservoir Dogs)
"Le MOXIE with cheese." (Pulp Fiction)
"Fat, drunk, and MOXIE is no way to go through life, son." (Animal House)
"Tina, you fat lard, come get some MOXIE!" (Napoleon Dynamite)
"Vote for Moxie" (take-off of Napoleon's 'Vote for Pedro' tee)

More to come...stay tuned...

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
I really like Monica (and friends) idea for "The first rule of Moxie is: You do not talk about Moxie!"

I think using Napoleon Dynamite on anything would be good marketing since it's so damn popular right now and more people would recognize where it's from as opposed to less popular indies. 

A few of my suggestions:
"We'll always have Moxie." [Casablanca]
"Meet me in Moxie." [Eternal Sunshine]
"Oh for pete's sake, he's fleeing the Moxie! He's feeling the Moxie!" [Fargo]
"For relaxing times, make it Moxie times." [Lost in Translation]
"Gee, I wish I had one of them Moxie machines." [Dr. Strangelove]
"Sometimes I doubt your commitment to Moxie." [Donnie Darko]

comments.author: Sam Spade
comments.body:
I just want to say one word to you - just one word.... Moxie.

Moxie, for lack of a better word, is good.

Can I have 10,000 Moxies please? (Yeah, stupid, I know.)

Of all the picture shows in all the towns in all the world, she walks into mine. (my personal fave)

Forget it, Jake, it's Moxietown.

All work and no Moxie makes Jack a dull boy (repeat across front and back)

And a few of my own...

The Moxie: Now Keanu Free!

Go to The Moxie! Because Beer Makes Every Movie Better

The Moxie: It's a soda! It's an independent theater! It's BOTH!

Uh, that's all I've got right now...

comments.author: Lor

comments.author: Emily the Marketing Dork
comments.body:
Shy about posting, so will make this long and a one-time-only performance...

I don't have any original ideas, but here's some input from someone who HASN'T been reading this site from the beginning (which, if you want to get technical, is important from an all-inclusive, wide-reaching marketing perspective).  I love Allison's screenshot idea of the obscure mountain lion-type photos, as well as the following T-shirt ideas: Nate's "Y Tu Moxie Tambien", "Miracle On Walnut Street", and LOTR; all of Caleb's suggestions; and Anemone's "Working...".  These are all popular indie, cult, or offbeat ideas which would play well to the kind of patrons you want.  Hell, I'm thinking of making my way to Springfield just to get Anemone's shirt.

Also, one hugely popular thing that an independent theater did in my college town was this: they determined in the first few months which was their slowest night each week, then regularly showed whatever they wanted on that night.  Sometimes they got 8 or 9 people in there watching something dumb like Major Payne; other times they SOLD OUT for an old Doris Day flick.  As college students, we actually all paid more attention to what the weird movie was that week, and half the time ended up going.

I've been enjoying the site for a few months now, and I wish you the best of luck!  Hope I haven't taken up too much of your time without meritorious contribution.  :-)
